Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is autoimmune pancreatitis (AIP). Diagnostic criteria for AIP require imaging findings of a narrowed main pancreatic duct and parenchymal swelling (“sausage-shaped” pancreas) as

) and response to glucocorticoids. A significant elevation of serum IgG4 level is helpful in diagnosing type 1 AIP. Patients with type 1 AIP also have elevated levels of IgG4-positive cells in pancreatic tissue (>10 IgG4-positive cells/hpf), and 60% to 80% of patients have associated sclerosing cholangitis, sclerosing sialadenitis, or retroperitoneal fibrosis.
